name: Aquatic Animal Sizing Exploration

0.content:
## Aquatic Animal Sizing Samples: From Small Fish to Whales

This dashboard explores the size diversity of aquatic animals using their length (in cm). From tiny fish to massive whales, explore length distributions across taxonomies.

The top 4 bar charts show Phylum, Class, Order, and Family distribution. Use them to click to filter. As they only show the top 15 values, access smaller average classes, use the top filter on size category to restrict.
0.name: Introduction and Usage

1.content:
where length_cm is not null
select
    class,
    count(column00) as total_samples,
    min(length_cm) as min_length_cm,
    avg(length_cm) as avg_length_cm,
    max(length_cm) as max_length_cm
order by
    class asc
limit 15;
1.name: Average Class Length

2.content:
where length_cm is not null and length_cm > 0  
select  
     log_length_bin,  
    sample_count  
order by  
    log_length_bin asc  
limit 100;
2.name: Overall Length Distribution

3.content:
where length_cm is not null
select
    genus.name,
    avg(length_cm) as avg_length_cm,
    count(column00) as total_samples,
order by
    avg_length_cm desc
limit 25
3.name: Sample Count by Genus

6.content:
where length_cm is not null
select
column00,
    family,
    length_cm,
    avg(length_cm) by family as avg_family_size
order by
    avg_family_size asc,
    family asc,
    length_cm asc,
limit 1000;
6.name: Distribution of Sizes

7.content:
select  
    scientificName,  
    class,  
    avg(length_cm) as avg_length_cm,  
    rank scientificName by avg_length_cm asc as rank_asc,  
    rank scientificName by avg_length_cm desc as rank_desc  
where  
    rank_asc <= 10 or rank_desc <= 10  
order by  
    rank_desc asc  
limit 20;
7.name: Largest and Smallest Species

9.content:
where length_cm is not null
select
    phylum,
    avg(length_cm) as avg_length_cm,
    count(column00) as total_samples,
order by
    avg_length_cm desc
limit 15;
9.name: Average Phylum Length

10.content:
where length_cm is not null
select
    orders,
    avg(length_cm) as avg_length_cm,
    count(column00) as total_samples,
order by
    avg_length_cm desc
limit 10;
10.name: Average Order Length

11.content:
where length_cm is not null
select
    family,
    avg(length_cm) as avg_length_cm,
    count(column00) as total_samples,
order by
    avg_length_cm desc
limit 10;
11.name: Average Family Length

14.content:
SELECT
    genus.image,
    --genus.name,
    -- avg(length_cm) as avg_length
order by 
    avg_length desc
    limit 1;
14.name: Biggest Boi

15.content:
### Phylum Drilldown

The left chart shows remaining phylum. Click on them to further filter. The largest phylum in the set will be shown on the right with a description below.
15.name: Note 15

16.content:
SELECT
    genus.description,
    --genus.name,
    -- avg(length_cm) as avg_length
order by 
    avg_length desc
    limit 1;
16.name: Table 16

description: This dashboard provides an in-depth exploration of aquatic animal sizing samples, focusing primarily on length measurements across a wide range of species from small fish to whales. The visualizations highlight differences by taxonomic class and genus, revealing distribution patterns, size extremes, and relationships between length and height. Use interactive charts to drill down into specific classes and genera, and explore the tables for detailed species insights.
